Looking for a spacious and luxurious townhouse for your next family vacation? Look no further than Champions Gate! This beautiful property is inspired by the Florida sun and influenced by the magic of Walt Disney World. You and your family will love the elegant style and premium location of this resort. Everything you need for an unforgettable experience is right here!

Come stay at our beautiful property that includes a private pool (Heating with extra fee), fully equipped kitchen, AC, bed linens, and 5 smart TVs with cable TV. You'll also enjoy the patio furniture, hair dryers, washer/dryer, ironing supplies, free parking, high speed internet, and hangers during your stay.

-  Bedroom #3 with a bunk bed (twin beds) and double size bed, as well as a smart TV. (Star Wars Thematic)
-  Bedroom #4 with a bunk bed (twin beds) and double size bed with a smart TV.  (Mickey Thematic)

Large Modern Townhouse Near U St. & Othe.description:
♢ Walk Score 95 (daily errands can be accomplished on foot)
♢ 10-min walk to the nearest METRO Subway station at Shaw station on the GRN/YLW Lines or ~15-minutes walk to NoMa-Gallaudet station on the Red Line
♢ <1 mile to Walter E. Washington Convention Center
♢ 9 min by car to downtown DC / Capitol Hill
♢ 36 min drive from Dulles Airport
♢ Smart HDTV w/cable
♢ FREE High-speed Wi-Fi
♢ FREE Street Parking
♢ Safe neighborhood
♢ Kid and family-friendlyThe Space→ All your essentials are provided: linens, towels, toiletries, coffee, etc.
→ Fully-stocked kitchen
→ Washer + Dryer for your laundering needs
→ Flexible check-in & check-out upon request

This large, modern house in the heart of Washington is the perfect base for exploring downtown. It's located just blocks from the metro station and a few minutes drive to all of DC’s major monuments. You can walk to trendy restaurants and coffee shops. Our house radiates luxury and the 3-bedroom, 2.5-bathroom set-up is ideal for families and groups of friends.

Here Are A Few Kind Words From Our Past Guests:

☆ “Stylish and spacious, convenient and affordable all in one package” - Bobby
☆ “Awesome location in walking distance of good eats and entertainment. Very spacious and cozy pad suitable for anyone looking to spend time in the DC area.” - Gordon
☆ "The inside of the home was incredibly clean, and the furniture was beautiful. The home is very large, and there is plenty of room to lounge around as well as a large dining table for eating meals. The kitchen was well stocked as were the bathrooms. " - Zac

Our historic home has everything you need to enjoy your DC stay with friends or family. Considering its central location, you might not want to pass it up. Besides your outside adventures and sightseeing, you'll find this house has everything you need to make time spent indoors pleasurable.

It's charming and warm, fully equipped with modern appliances and amenities. You'll enjoy the large spaces and warmly furnished rooms.

BEDROOMS:
Our condo has 3 full bedrooms and can sleep up to 8 guests. 

The master bedroom is spacious. There's a Queen bed with a memory foam mattress for a restful sleep. There's also a pull-out bed to add to the number of bed spaces should you need it. Kids especially will love sleeping in the same room as their parents when in a new environment. 

If you need to catch up with some work, there's a chair and work table, wide enough for a laptop and extra documents.

There are two other bedrooms in the house with two single beds in both of them. You'll find the futon in the living room converts to a single bed. And for yet more space, there's a Queen size, extra-thick air mattress with a built-in pump that can be set up in just minutes.

All your bedding is provided, and there are extra pillows and blankets available for you to use.

BATHROOMS:
The bathrooms in the house are pristine and fully functional. An ensuite bathroom is attached to the master bedroom, complete with shower, bath, toilet and plenty of counter space. 

The second full bathroom offers a shower, bath, toilet, and sink. There’s also a separate toilet downstairs.

We provide toilet paper, soap, shampoo, and towels, and there is also a hairdryer available.
Feel free to use the washer and dryer.

KITCHEN:
To whip up a meal, head to the fully-equipped kitchen that boasts granite countertops, stainless appliances, and a gas range. The double fridge makes it easy for large groups to stock up on groceries. Cooking pots, pans, and utensils are all provided to make meal preparation a breeze. 
You’ll find dishes and silverware stored in the cabinets and drawers, and you can then enjoy meals in the open, well-lit dining area.

LIVING ROOM:
Tastefully decorated in a modern style, the condo’s spacious living room is the perfect place to chill after a long day of exploring DC. Its comfortable sofas and warm lighting make relaxing the default. Stretch out on the chaise lounge, grab some snacks and pick a movie from the Smart HDTV’s Netflix app. High-speed internet and Amazon’s Alexa are also at your service.

OUTSIDE SPACE:
Enjoy your morning coffee or evening glass of wine with some fresh air. The condo’s shared backyard offers a lovely green space with trees and plants. Barbeques are always special, you are welcome to make use of the BBQ grill and tables. There are wooden chairs to sit on and a hammock too for a nice stretch.

★☆ Book Today & Let Us Take Care Of You In Washington! ☆★Guest AccessPlease make yourself at home. You’ll have access to the entire private house and the shared courtyard and patio.

The unit’s entrance has a keypad entry system that allows you to come and go without the hassle of carrying a key. This makes it especially easy for a large group. All codes are changed after checkout, providing guests with safety and security.

There is free street parking, and our central location means many outings can be accomplished on foot. The closest metro station is a ten-minute walk away.

KEY FEATURES:

☀ Spacious, beautifully-decorated townhouse
☀ Central location, minutes from downtown Washington DC
☀ Walk Score 94 (daily errands easily accomplished on foot)
☀ 3 bedrooms, 2.5 bathrooms
☀ Fully-equipped kitchen with granite countertops
☀ Large living room with Smart HDTV + Netflix
☀ Backyard with hammock
☀ Washer and dryer in the house
☀ High-speed Wifi, Amazon’s Alexa
☀ Free street parking
☀ Kid- and family-friendly rentalNeighborhoodFind out more about the neighborhood here:   airbnb.com/locations/washington-dc/shaw  or

You’ll be surrounded by visitors and residents from all walks of life in this home, which is located in an ethnically and culturally diverse area of the city. The location doesn’t get any better than this centrally-located home, which is walking distance to tourist attractions, cafes, shops and restaurants. Talk a short walk to explore this culturally-diverse neighborhood, or rent a bike at the nearby bikeshare station. The home is also located near two Metro Stations, providing you with affordable and easy access to all areas of the city.InteractionI am here for you during your stay, but our level of interaction is up to you. I'm only a phone call/message away. You will be able to check yourselves in upon arrival.Other things to noteThe backyard space is a shared space, so please ensure you are courteous to the neighbors. 

Please treat the space with respect. If any problems arise, we will do our best to take action ASAP, but there is no one living on site 24/7.

Surveillance or recording devices on property - We use a noise monitoring device; It does NOT record actual sounds or conversations, it simply monitors the noise level (measured in decibels). Violators will be charged a $200 fine. This property may use NoiseAware technology to ensure the comfort and security of the guest. Tampering with the device is strictly prohibited and will result in a $200 fine.

Pet is allowed, but there will be an additional non-refundable pet fee of $80.00 per pet per stay for a maximum of a five (5) night stay for the extra work involved in the cleaning and other related services related to the pet(s). Also, if your stay is more than five (5) nights, a fee of $10 per additional night will apply.Getting Around→ Capital Bikeshare Station is located within walking distance
→ 2 Metro Stations located within one mile from the home
→ 2 bus stops located within walking distance
→ No designated parking, but street parking is available in the vicinity

1BR Oasis near Takoma Metro, Minutes to.title: 1BR Oasis near Takoma Metro, Minutes to Capital
1BR Oasis near Takoma Metro, Minutes to.description:
My place is a 10-minute walk from the Takoma Metro Station and a 5-minute walk to the Takoma Recreation Center, and a Safeway (Grocery store). You’ll love my place because of the well-lit living area, the comfy bed, and the coziness. My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, business travelers, and small families.The SpaceWashington D.C.’s Takoma neighborhood is a diverse, middle-class neighborhood that is an ideal location for those visiting the city for business or pleasure. A downtown renovation project has brought in new businesses, making this area one of D.C.’s up-and-coming neighborhoods. Visitors can enjoy viewing the beautiful historic homes, visiting the Takoma Recreation Center which features a pool, skate park, playgrounds, and special events, or taking a 10-minute walk to the Takoma Metro station to explore the history and excitement of the nation’s capital. 

When not taking in the sites that the city has to offer, you can rest easy in this 1-bedroom fully-furnished basement apartment. You will be able to enjoy privacy and comfort while relaxing after sightseeing or taking a break from business. This apartment is stylishly appointed with the modern amenities you need for an enjoyable and relaxing stay. Kick back and enjoy watching your favorite TV shows or movies on the wall-mounted LCD television with cable in the living room, or simply share a story from the spacious and comfortable sectional sofa. Keep your favorite snacks on hand in the cozy kitchen area.  Though it's not a full kitchen it is equipped with a mini fridge, microwave, and coffee maker.  The house is also furnished with a front-load washer and dryer.  

This apartment features a private bedroom with a comfortable Queen bed for an exceptional night of rest of the sleeper. The bedroom is also equipped with a desk to provide workspace for those traveling to the city for business. You also have your own private bathroom that is stocked with essentials, including bath towels, shampoo, and other toiletries for a refreshing shower. You’ll be able to stay connected with our high speed Wi-Fi service, so you can keep in contact with family, post photos of your travel, or finish up your work outside of the office. 

Check-ins are available 24-hours a day, so late arrivals are no problem. It might not be a condo, but this apartment is kid-friendly, so guests with small families are welcome. This space comfortably sleeps three people and is located in a safe and friendly neighborhood and is equipped with a carbon monoxide detector, smoke detector, and first-aid kit for your safety.Guest AccessGuests have a private entry access to the house and have the entire basement (not an upstairs condo) to themselves. There is available space in the backyard / courtyard for guests to enjoy a relaxing moment. There is also street parking for small group of guests with a car. The kitchen has shared room space for an in unit washer and dryer. Key to enjoy the day: Ask. :)NeighborhoodSingles, couples, families, and other travelers can feel safe and secure in the Takoma neighborhood. This historic area boasts beautiful homes in a quiet area, yet is just a 5-minute walk from the Takoma Recreation Center, a 10-minute walk to the Takoma metro station, and is conveniently located to a Safeway grocery store for stocking up on snacks and supplies.InteractionI travel for business and do not live in the home, so my access to phone calls may be limited during your stay.  However, I will do my best to provide you with timely and prompt responses via the app when needed, while also giving you space and privacy during your stay.Other things to noteWhile small families or multiple guests are allowed to stay at the property, we do not permit parties or events. Parties and events thrown at this location are subject to additional charges.

Paper products such as paper towels and toilet paper will be refreshed and provided to you prior to your arrival, but you will be responsible for replenishing should you run out during your stay and need more.Getting AroundThe best way to take advantage of everything that Washington D.C. has to offer is via the Takoma Metro station, which is just a 10-minute walk from your apartment. Bike share service is available at the station for those who want to tour the Manor Park area by bike, and car sharing and bus service are also available transportation options available at the Takoma station.

Experience life as a local and truly enjoy your next DC vacation with a stay at this beautiful 2-story row home.  You’ll find that comfort and privacy abound in this private home, which offers luxurious amenities and that extra special touch you won’t find at other rentals in the area.

The central location puts you close to all of the fun, excitement, and history found in the city, while providing you with plenty of space for relaxation. Enjoy hanging out in the backyard after a long day of sightseeing, put your favorite movie on the flat-panel Roku TV, or order some take-out with the Amazon Echo while listening to your favorite music.  The living area is also business-ready with a desk available should you need to get some work done during your stay.

Just off the kitchen is a dining area with seating for four. Enjoy a quick breakfast or an espresso before visiting DC’s landmarks, or enjoy a dinner prepared in the fully-stocked kitchen. There you can also feel free to pick whatever fresh herbs, fruits or vegetables you might find ready to harvest!

Your friends and family will rest in comfort in the 3 bedrooms. The master bedroom is fitted with a queen bed, a small walk-in closet, and an en suite bathroom. The second  bedroom has a full bed for two additional guests.  The third room maximizes space with a queen Murphy bed, freeing up this room for other activities and easy access to the balcony when the bed isn’t in use. The small balcony off of the third bedroom can be used as an alternative workspace, or simply another place for you to spread out and take in some fresh air. A second full bathroom is available between the bedrooms and includes a tub.  All of the beds are fitted with sheets and thick, plush comforters to provide peaceful rest for everyone.  There is also a pack-n-play available (i.e. portable crib) with its own mattress and sheets available for guests to use, and then if need be the Murphy bedroom can easily be set up for use as a nursery for guests with infants.

For your convenience, high-speed Wi-Fi is available free-of-charge so you can connect with your friends and family at home, or keep up with your work emails. The home also comes with one secured off-street parking spot for any reasonably sized vehicle in a driveway behind the home, and free street parking close-by as well should you happen to have multiple vehicles.Guest AccessGuests have full access to the entire home as well as the backyard space, providing plenty of privacy and room to spread out.  For your convenience, we installed a keypad entry to the home, allowing you go about your day without having to track a key. Hill East is a great residential neighborhood adjacent to Capitol Hill. It is primarily residential, but just far enough from downtown that there is space for plenty of services, including full-sized supermarkets, parks, and playgrounds. It is very walkable and sufficiently close to everything that you won’t feel too far out in the suburbs. Eastern Market and Lincoln Park are conveniently located for your children to play, or to get some people-watching in.  

While there are some friendly neighborhood bars and restaurants in Hill East, you’ll find many more options right in Capitol Hill on 8th Street, or the nearby lively H Street Corridor. You can quickly get to those parts of town if you want; it is a longish walk, or you can simply take the Metro that is only two blocks away. Parking is usually easy to come by. If you happen to be a soccer fan, DC United's RFK stadium is less than a 10-minute walk away for getting out to a game while you're in town.  If you're looking for my personal recommendations of places to go or things to see, please ask me!
 
Perhaps the biggest advantage of Hill East (sometimes also called Barney Circle) is the strong sense of community. It is the sort of place where residents know each other by name, and help one another with yard work.

Logan Circle is one of the city’s trendiest neighborhoods, drawing a fashionable young crowd to 14th Street’s stylish home-decor stores and hip restaurants, bars and craft beer pubs. The long-established Studio Theatre presents boundary-pushing contemporary performances, and offers acting lessons. Charming, well-preserved Victorian houses are grouped around the leafy namesake traffic circle.

People are naturally drawn to living steps from the food markets and the nearby farmers market. Throw in the crop of new restaurants, Studio Theatre and the green space of Logan Circle and that pretty much seals the deal. The eminently walkable 0.63-square-mile neighborhood is the fastest-growing and most densely populated in the District.

The 14th Street commercial corridor is bustling. You can get practically everything you need in the radius of a few blocks — groceries, prescriptions, wine, hardware, even running shoes. 

Some local favorites in the area are Garden District, Number Nine, Masa 14, Black Whiskey, and brunch at Le Diplomate!

FAMILY-FRIENDLY / SUBWAY / ROOFTOP DECK.title: FAMILY-FRIENDLY / SUBWAY / ROOFTOP DECK / AU
FAMILY-FRIENDLY / SUBWAY / ROOFTOP DECK.description:
♢ Only 3 blocks! to the nearest Metro subway station at Tenleytown-AU on the Red Line
♢ Super convenient to American University (AU)
♢ 10-minutes by car to downtown Washington DC
♢ Fully fitted rooftop deck for your enjoyment
♢ Nursery accommodates even the tiniest of our guests :)
♢ Smart HDTV w cable + Netflix in living room
♢ FREE 105MBPS High-speed Wi-Fi
♢ Amazon's Alexa at your service w/in-house Echo
♢ FREE Parking in driveway
♢ Kid- & family-friendly rentalThe SpaceWelcome to our home in DC! 

This house on Albemarle St Northwest was constructed in 1949 on what at the time was undeveloped land in the DC commuter suburb of Tenleytown. It was sold to its first owner the same year for the bargain price of $6000.

Christina and I took one look at this house and fell in love. 53 years after its first purchase, in the summer of 2012 we became the 2nd owners (we unfortunately had to pay a bit more than $6k). The house was in such bad shape it scared most everyone away! I didn’t know this at the time, but my bride likes her houses the same as her men - rough-around-the-edges but charming with lots of potential. 

We spent the next 4 years making this place our own. Fast forward to today - this little house has seen 3 engagements (our own and 2 of our best friends’), multiple renovations, a new baby, and too many all-day BBQs to remember. Work took both of us away in 2016, but we still try to get back as much as we can to unwind.

DC is phenomenal city! There’s lots of fun to be had here - very accessible by foot, great sites, lots of history, tons of excellent food and even a bit of charm if you look in the right places! We’re glad you’re here and hope you love the house and the city as much as we do.

Nestled in upper Northwest DC, Tenleytown is the District’s second oldest community. A blend of quiet neighborhood and urban center, Tenleytown is a wonderful area to explore.

We recommend the following:

-Coffee 
  • Bread Furst
  • Bourbon Coffee

-Lunch
  • Tons of restaurants on Wisconsin St (turn left on Albemarle, walk straight for 3 blocks, turn right on Wisconsin)
  • Be sure to check out "Little Red Fox" on Connecticut. Awesome sandwiches and crazy good desserts

-Dinner
   • Le Chat Noir
   • Sfoglina

-Hidden park
  • Wonderful little hidden park by the Austrian Embassy at 36 and Yuma. 10 minutes away - Take an evening stroll.Guest AccessThere is a Roku on the main floor.  The Roku controller will power on both the TV and the Roku.  Please remember to sign out of all streaming services before you leave!

Secret Basement room: Sony TV remote turns on TV. Press 'Home' on remote to get the Android TV menu. All apps accessible from there.NeighborhoodNestled in-between the DC wards of Van Ness and Tenleytown, this area has a small-town feel with all the amenities of the city.  Perched on the city’s highest point, Tenleytown in Northwest Washington is the place to find almost anything you want. And if you can’t find what you’re looking for, it’s probably just a short walk or Metro ride away.

Wide sidewalks along Tenleytown’s sloping, tree-lined residential streets make getting around the neighborhood a breeze, whether it’s a morning walk with the dog or a trip to one of the many shops or restaurants lining Wisconsin Avenue. A Metro stop at the heart of the neighborhood provides easy access to the rest of Washington and the surrounding region. It has all the best things about being a small town with access to all the great things about being in the city.

Van Ness is full of elaborate foodie, bookworm, and museum guests. Head there for some of the best taste tester tours, author talks at the local used book store, museums, and serene parks to explore.

There is a Capital bike share station right outside the Van Ness Metro so feel free to ride in style or walk around this wonderful part of your Nation’s capital with a smile.
Enjoy plenty of shops, restaurants, and cafes, where you can get all kinds of eats and treats. You can even hop on board one of Mangia’s food tours to get the inside scoop on the best places to eat in the area.

If you’re more of an art and culture lover, this is the right place for you! Van Ness abounds with museums and galleries that you can stop by to learn more about our nation’s capital and what makes living in DC unique.Other things to noteSurveillance or recording devices on property - We use a noise monitoring device; It does NOT record actual sounds or conversations, it simply monitors the noise level (measured in decibels). Violators will be charged a $200 fine. This property may use NoiseAware technology to ensure the comfort and security of the guest. Tampering with the device is strictly prohibited and will result in a $200 fine.

Please note that there is a security camera on the outside of the property. It only records video of the outside of the property.Getting AroundOnly 3 blocks! to the nearest Metro subway station at Tenleytown-AU on the Red Line

Uber and Lyft taxi cabs readily available.  Simply download their app to your phone and input your trip to be picked up in a matter of minutes.
amenities: Path to entrance lit at night

This large, modern house in the heart of Washington is the perfect base for exploring downtown. It's located just blocks from the metro station and a few minutes drive to all of DC’s major monuments. You can walk to trendy restaurants and coffee shops. Our house radiates luxury and the 5-BR, 3.5-bath set-up is ideal for families and groups alike!The SpaceHere Are A Few Kind Words From Our Past Guests:

☆ “Stylish and spacious, convenient and affordable all in one package” - Bobby
☆ “Awesome location in walking distance of good eats and entertainment. Very spacious and cozy pad suitable for anyone looking to spend time in the DC area.” - Gordon
☆ "The inside of the home was incredibly clean, and the furniture was beautiful. The home is very large, and there is plenty of room to lounge around as well as a large dining table for eating meals. The kitchen was well stocked as were the bathrooms. " - Zac

Our historic home has everything you need to enjoy your DC stay with friends or family. Considering its central location, you might not want to pass it up. Besides your outside adventures and sightseeing, you'll find this house has everything you need to make time spent indoors pleasurable.

It's charming and warm, fully equipped with modern appliances and amenities. You'll enjoy the large spaces and warmly furnished rooms.

BEDROOMS:
Our condo has 5 full bedrooms and can sleep up to 14 guests. 

The master bedroom is spacious. There's a Queen bed with a memory foam mattress for a restful sleep. There's also a pull-out bed to add to the number of bed spaces should you need it. Kids especially will love sleeping in the same room as their parents when in a new environment. 

If you need to catch up with some work, there's a chair and work table, wide enough for a laptop and extra documents.

There are two other bedrooms in the house with two single beds in both of them. You'll find the futon in the living room converts to a single bed. And for yet more space, there's a Queen size, extra-thick air mattress with a built-in pump that can be set up in just minutes.

The basement has two other bedroom with two single beds in both of them.

All your bedding is provided, and there are extra pillows and blankets available for you to use.

BATHROOMS:
The bathrooms in the house are pristine and fully functional. An ensuite bathroom is attached to the master bedroom, complete with shower, bath, toilet and plenty of counter space. 

The second full bathroom offers a shower, bath, toilet, and sink. There’s also a separate toilet downstairs.

We provide toilet paper, soap, shampoo, and towels, and there is also a hairdryer available.
Feel free to use the washer and dryer.

KITCHEN:
To whip up a meal, head to the fully-equipped kitchen that boasts granite countertops, stainless appliances, and a gas range. The double fridge makes it easy for large groups to stock up on groceries. Cooking pots, pans, and utensils are all provided to make meal preparation a breeze. 
You’ll find dishes and silverware stored in the drawers and you can enjoy meals in the open, well-lit dining area.

LIVING ROOM:
Tastefully decorated in a modern style, the condo’s spacious living room is the perfect place to chill after a long day of exploring DC. Its comfortable sofas and warm lighting make relaxing the default. Stretch out on the chaise lounge, grab some snacks and pick a movie from the Smart HDTV’s Netflix app. High-speed internet and Amazon’s Alexa are also at your service.

OUTSIDE SPACE:
Enjoy your morning coffee or evening glass of wine with some fresh air. The condo’s shared backyard offers a lovely green space with trees and plants. Barbeques are always special, you are welcome to make use of the BBQ grill and tables. There are wooden chairs to sit on and a hammock too for a nice stretch.

★☆ Book Today & Let Us Take Care Of You In Washington! ☆★Guest AccessPlease make yourself at home. You’ll have access to the entire private house and the shared courtyard and patio.

The unit’s entrance has a keypad entry system that allows you to come and go without the hassle of carrying a key. This makes it especially easy for a large group. All codes are changed after checkout, providing guests with safety and security.

There is free street parking, and our central location means many outings can be accomplished on foot. The closest metro station is a ten-minute walk away.

Monuments and memorials, eclectic neighborhoods, true local flavor – Washington, DC is a place unlike any other. It’s your home away from home with world-class museums, historic attractions and a vibrant cultural scene that will thrill foodies, music lovers and history buffs alike. Plan your trip to the nation’s capital by checking out all the things to do, places to eat and ways to stay: ask me for more info!

The apartment is centrally located in the famous Dupont Circle neighborhood - perfect for those who want a to be walking distance to some of the nation's best restaurants, shopping and attractions. The best way to start your day is at Emissary Coffee, located on the first floor of Dupont Circle Yoga - just two blocks away at the corner of 21st and P. Then hop on the metro for a quick 5-10 minute ride to the National Mall to visit museums, monuments and more. Or head to historic Georgetown - a 10 minute walk from the apartment - where you'll find great food, shopping and more. Visit anything and everything from this centrally-located apartment. Art-lovers can gallery-hop around for First Friday Dupont or experience America’s first museum of modern art, The Phillips Collection. Globally minded folks should trek down Embassy Row, which starts on Massachusetts Avenue and cuts right through the circle. This cosmopolitan neighborhood offers a little something for everyone. An array of unique shops and exciting restaurants along Connecticut Avenue, one of the busy streets in the neighborhood, is exciting enough to keep you going all day.  Get in some time at the Dupont Circle fountain to read, people-watch or meet up with others.

Don't forget to book your dinner reservations on OpenTable. I can let you know about the hottest new restaurants around town, just send me a note, or check out this link:
https://www.airbnb.com/locations/washington-dc/dupont-circleInteractionI offer self check-in for your convenience and flexible check-in but am only a message away should you need anything at all. For your convenience, we installed a keypad entry to the home, allowing you go about your day without having to track a key. The code is changed after check-out.Other things to note**Surveillance or recording devices on property - We use a noise monitoring device; It does NOT record actual sounds or conversations, it simply monitors the noise level (measured in decibels). Violators will be charged a $200 fine. This property may use NoiseAware technology to ensure the comfort and security of the guest. Tampering with the device is strictly prohibited and will result in a $200 fine.**

• High-speed wireless internetThe Space→ Fully-stocked kitchen
→ Onsite washer + dryer

This Georgetown location puts you close to all of the fun, excitement, and history to be found in the city. You’ll be located in the renowned and upscale area that is Georgetown with no shortage on things to do and see within walking distance. Walk up to the apartment and you’ll immediately notice: 

-Open and spacious floor plan 
-Hardwood floors throughout
-Tastefully-appointed furnishings

*Bedrooms*

-Master bedroom has a Queen bed with an en suite toilet and shower. 
-The second bedroom is cozy providing you with some extra storage in the credenza. 
-All beds are fitted with microfiber sheets and thick, plush comforters to provide peaceful rest for everyone.

*Balcony*

The 2 bedrooms are separated on the outside by a delightful balcony space where you can enjoy some fresh air on a beautiful day in the city. Both rooms have their own private exit to this balcony space.

*Entertainment and work*

- Stream your favorite show or movie on the LCD flat-panel TV with Netflix, Hulu, or your favorite streaming app.  
- Surfing the web from anywhere in the home using the complimentary high-speed WiFi connection 
- Catch up on your work emails in a wonderful sunny ambiance that the living area and seated table offers, where you can also people watch out the window those shopping and dining right outside!NeighborhoodThe perfect intersection of historic charm and upscale modernity happens where M Street meets Wisconsin Avenue in the heart of picturesque Georgetown.
Diners outside at Fiola Mare seafood restaurant in Georgetown - Restaurant on the waterfront in Washington, DC

The beauty of Georgetown’s cobblestone sidewalks, grand homes and peaceful C&O Canal are only part of the draw to this tree-lined historic neighborhood – as home to some of the city’s top shops, tastiest restaurants and most luxurious hotels, Georgetown is a favorite of tourists and locals alike. And it’s easy to see why: Though M Street may be best known for a wide-ranging retail scene that includes such mainstream crowd-pleasers as Anthropologie and H&M and exclusive high-end designers like Billy Reid and Rag & Bone, the neighborhood is also home to a solid selection of upscale home design stores, independent small businesses and many of the city’s best fine art galleries.InteractionWe offer self-checkin for your convenience, and so no one will be meeting you at the property.  However, we are only a message away should you need anything at all!Other things to noteHouse rules are taken very seriously, and a violation of any one of them will result in an extra penalty fee of upwards of $500.  This includes any complaints from neighbors, any evidence remaining in the home of a party or event be held, or any bad odors as a result of smoking in the home.Getting AroundThere are 2 Metro bus stops within 1 block south on the same street as the property, which can be ridden to get to the closest Metro sub station and beyond, anywhere throughout the city.
Also two Capital Bikeshares about equidistant from the property, either 3 blocks north or south on Wisconsin Ave.

✧ Comfortable & Clean ✧ Private Studio i.title: ✧ Comfortable & Clean ✧ Private Studio in Serene DC Neighborhood with Responsive & Friendly Host ✧
✧ Comfortable & Clean ✧ Private Studio i.description:
You’ll have the apartment to yourself.

♢ Upscale DC neighborhood of Crestwood, an island of serenity east of Rock Creek Park
♢ Hi-Speed Wi-Fi
♢ HD SmartTV w/ Roku
♢ Washer + dryer
♢ 5 min drive and 20 min walk to nearest Metro subway 
♢ 10 min walk to S9 Express bus or 15 minute taxi/Uber ride to downtown Washington, DCThe Space**********************************PLEASE READ BEFORE BOOKING + ADDITIONAL RULES AT THE END **********************************************
As important as reading what the space offers, is understanding what it does not:
•	The neighborhood is mostly families with young children and elderly residents.  Smoking of any kind or lighting fires (e.g., candles or incense) inside the unit, on premises, or in public spaces around the home is prohibited.  If you are seeking to smoke or light any sort of flames, please, kindly look for another home.
•	The neighborhood is a designated drug-free zone.
•	We, ourselves, are a family of four (including two young, school-aged children and at least one of us who sometimes quietly works from home).  The kids are in school M-F and often outdoors and out of the house on weekends.  However, you may still hear them, especially during dinner time – they are very sweet, I assure you.  We also sometimes play basketball in the driveway, located in front of the unit.  
•	This unit is in the lower level of our home.  Please note that the rental only includes the unit itself and the immediate entryway – the front and backyards are private and, unfortunately, not open to guests at this time. 
•	Sorry, no pets allowed.
•	Please note that there are outdoor security cameras on the premises.
•	The unit is strictly limited to the use of up to two people.  Please respect that this is a space for paying guests, not for inviting/entertaining other guests that are not part of the reservation.
•	The neighborhood is far from a busy, urban space – it is extremely quiet and residential.  It is not a place where loud noises/music, disruption, or any sort of partying is welcomed.  
•	Come here for the same reason we, and all our neighbors live here:  an escape, a getaway, and far enough from the action, yet still close to all DC has to offer.
•	If you ever need anything – please ask.  We are very responsive and happy to help!
**********************************************************  THANK YOU !! **********************************************************

Enjoy everything DC has to offer from the lower level of my family's home, in this inviting studio apartment!  The space was designed by one of the area’s top architects and design firms and features high-end finishes, such as: Benjamin Moore’s color of the year, Simply White, throughout the home; rare and stylish Volga Blue granite countertops; a custom-made “barn-style” closet door; recessed dimmable lights; and a functional open layout.  Key-less entry, through your own private entrance, makes check-in a breeze.

The unit is perfect for both business and relaxed pleasure visits to our nation’s capital.  Just one mile away, you will find the nearest subway station, which can take you anywhere you need to be around the city and beyond.  Even closer, and only a few blocks away, you can access the S9 Express and S4 buses, which take you straight down 16th Street, and into the heart of the District in minutes!  There is also a Capital Bikeshare depot two blocks away and ample street parking. 

For my more outdoorsy guests, there are two beautiful parks for hiking, nearly adjacent to the home:  Piney Branch Park and the District’s “crown jewel,” Rock Creek Park.  Critically-acclaimed restaurants, cafes, and entertainment abound in the neighboring Columbia Heights, Petworth, Mt. Pleasant, and U Street Corridor areas of the city, which are close enough to be easily accessible, but far enough away for you to comfortably enjoy the serenity of our peaceful neighborhood—we are always happy to provide you with additional recommendations, should you want them.

The studio can comfortably sleep up to a maximum of two (2) people, whether on the ultra-relaxing Serta memory foam queen bed or the chic Room & Board-designed futon sofa bed.  The unit comes fully-equipped with a kitchenette, featuring an induction burner, coffee maker, tea kettle, disposal, Delta Trinsic fixtures, full-size Samsung stainless steel fridge and freezer, as well as a washer & dryer for your laundering convenience.  The studio also has a 40” SmartTV plus Roku to stream your favorite programs.

***Please Note: this is the lower-level of a home belonging to my family of four:  two adults, a 5-year old, and a 7-year old.  While we have done our best to soundproof the home, you will likely hear the noises of our active, energetic, children running and playing if you stay here.***NeighborhoodCheck out Airbnb's guide to my neighborhood → airbnb.com/things-to-do/d.c. ; airbnb.com/locations/washington-dc/16th-street-heights ;

This home is in Crestwood, a neighborhood with green lawns, beautiful houses, and quiet streets virtually devoid of traffic just to the north of Columbia Heights and Mount Pleasant. And if you’ve never heard of Crestwood, you’re not alone. The relatively peaceful, upscale residential area that sits between 16th Street and Rock Creek Park is located near some of the city’s more popular neighborhoods, but is simultaneously isolated.

Crestwood is distinctly quieter than neighborhoods just a few blocks away, and there’s almost no through traffic. Many of the homes sit on large plots of land that haven’t been subdivided for new construction, and just about every lawn is green and dotted with flowering bushes. Crestwood is essentially an island of serenity east of the Park.InteractionWhile I offer self-check-in for your convenience to avoid any hassle in coordinating our schedules together, I am always only a message away should you need anything at all!Other things to noteFYI, there are outdoor security cameras on the premises.

Additional Rules:
Do NOT flush anything other than toilet paper.  No feminine products, baby wipes, condoms, nor paper towels should be flushed at any time.  If it is found that any of these items have been flushed and clog the septic system you will be held responsible for the cost of repair.  NO smoking, no candles, no incense or lighting flames of any kind please (fire hazard).
This is an extremely quiet, calm part of DC.  We ask all guests to please be courteous to my neighbors and others at this property above by keeping noise volumes at a reasonable level at ALL times.  From 10 PM - 8 AM please adhere to very strict quiet hours, where noise is kept to an absolute minimum.
Though there is no driveway parking, there is ample off-street parking for guests.  We do ask that you please be sure to park in a manner that allows the most number of cars to park on the street (e.g., you should be able to fit two cars if you park directly in front of our home).  

While we do feel comfortable and safe in the area, we do urge all guests to be very mindful of their belongings in their vehicles and in the unit – make sure to always lock doors and keep valuables out of sight!  

Lastly, while the space is thoroughly insulated, we have a recently-installed 16 SEER high-efficiency Bryant HVAC unit, and we provide a thick, cozy comforter, blanket, and space heater, please be mindful that heat does rise and so basements tend to be cooler than the rest of the house during winter time.  Keeping the storm door closed at all times can help with this.  Note that the portable heater is not designed to heat the entire studio, but to provide direct heat to you for short periods (and we want to be mindful of energy costs).  Also, we are always available and on-call to adjust the temperature to maximize your comfort, so please let us know.Getting AroundI highly recommend using ride-sharing services:
lyft.com / invited/ 5STARSTAY
Code: 5STARSTAY

→ Metro bus stops nearby 
→ 10 minute drive to the nearest metro station, Georgia Ave-Petworth
amenities: Path to entrance lit at night

Spacious and Stylish // 3 Units // True.title: Spacious and Stylish // 3 Units // True Heart of the City
Spacious and Stylish // 3 Units // True.description:
Kick back and enjoy not one or two but THREE individual spaces all to yourselves,  together in this historic gaslight building that was originally a popular speakeasy. Each unit has plenty of natural lighting illuminates this tastefully appointed apartment featuring modern amenities and intriguing artworks. Make your DC stay an unforgettable one in these unique spaces!The SpaceThe first thing you’ll undoubtedly notice when pulling up to this historic Gaslight building is a plain view of the Capital's defining landmark, the Washington Monument, from this 16th St NW location. You can have an unforgettable vacation starting with this space, with amenities and extras at a very competitive price.

These 3 private 2-BR vacation apartments (3x 2-bedrooms) are uniquely housed on three floors, 6th, 7th, and the remodeled 8th-floor penthouse of the historic Gaslight Club building - under this listing you are renting them all at once!  The building's lift will take you up to access your spacious abodes on 6th, 7th, and 8th floors of the building. Enjoy your DC vacation or business stay without the cramped feel of a hotel room in this space which combines charm and history with modern conveniences that make your stay extra special.

Step off the elevator directly into the corridor where you'll access your private apartments. Sit back and watch the big game or your favorite movie on the wall-mounted SmartTVs, or surf the web on your iPad or laptop with the free high-speed wireless internet service.

Feeling hungry? If you feel like staying in instead of heading out to one of the nearby restaurants, you’ll find everything you need in the kitchens that are available in each unit. The kitchens feature all the appliances you'll need, all your kitchen utensils, and a dishwasher to make clean up a breeze. You can cook your favorite meals or enjoy a quick breakfast using the cookware, place settings, utensils, and other kitchen supplies available for your use.

The 3 units each have two bedrooms, each outfitted with a queen bed enhanced with memory foam mattress, providing a comfortable sleeping area for up to four guests. Microfiber sheets and comforters are on all beds for a cozy, warm night of rest. Both have two private bathrooms with a shower/tub combo for your convenience. The bathrooms are fully stocked with the essentials you'll need to feel right at home.

You will also have a washer/dryer combination machine in every apartment.NeighborhoodDouglas’s place is located in Washington, District of Columbia, United States.
Set in Penn Quarter, the apartment is only a couple blocks from popular DC sites such as the Washington Monument and the White House. Walk a bit farther and enjoy the sights and sounds of Downtown, Gallery-Place Chinatown, and the National Mall.Getting AroundThe McPherson Square metro station is a short 5-minute away, with nearby metro bus stops as well. Never short of a taxi passing by. car2go also available, download the app for cars nearby!

Transit-Friendly Home // Old Town // Par.title: Transit-Friendly Home // Old Town // Parking
Transit-Friendly Home // Old Town // Par.description:
♢ Walkscore 87 (Most errands can be accomplished on foot!) 
♢ ONLY a 5-minute walk to closest Metro subway : Braddock Rd station on the Blue&Yellow Line
♢ 15-20 minute walk to favorite destination of Old Towne Alexandria
♢ Smart HDTVs : stream Netflix, Hulu, etc.
♢ High-speed Wi-Fi
♢ FREE parking
♢ Kid & Family-friendly rentalThe Space→ High-end modern amenities
→ One dedicated parking space behind the home
→ Onsite washer + dryer in spacious laundry room
→ 2 full bathrooms

Make your trip one you won’t soon forget after booking this lovely home just minutes from the closest Metro subway transit and beloved favorite Old Towne Alexandria. Enjoy all of the comforts of home during your stay at this classy, cozy and inviting 2-bedroom home that truly has it all.NeighborhoodFounded in 1749, Old Towne Alexandria is Older than the United States, and was founded by Scottish and English settlers. Its streets, waterfront and stately homes are absolutely beautiful. Many are also a bit famous! We have one of America's oldest continuously running farmers Markets in front of city hall just a few blocks away, and gobs of historical sights from early colonial days, the American Revolution, and the Civil War.  There's always something to do, or see--or eat--in Old Towne!InteractionWe won't be there to meet you but offer self-check-in for your convenience to avoid us needing to coordinate our schedules.  Always only a message away though should you need anything at all!Getting AroundBraddock Road Metro is across the street.
DASH bus stop is on the corner of Pendleton and N West and at the Metro
Capital Bikeshare is available at the corner of Pendleton and N. Henry and at the Metro.

A Stylish Stay w/ a Queen Bed, Heated Fl.title: A Stylish Stay w/ a Queen Bed, Heated Floors; #17
A Stylish Stay w/ a Queen Bed, Heated Fl.description:
In the heart of Coolidge Corner right off the Green Line, our picturesque studio apartment is a quick train ride to Fenway, Faneuil Hall and the Back Bay. Our space is perfect for solo adventures, business travel, or visiting students at the many neighboring universities. Sleep comfortably on pillow-top mattresses. Other features include heated bathroom floors and shared beautiful stainless steel full kitchens with crafted Italian Granite counter tops.The SpaceKnown as an integral part of Boston’s neighborhoods, Coolidge Corner in Brookline is known for its modern yet heavily-rooted historic novice, as the hometown and birthplace of John F. Kennedy. The bustling community of Coolidge Corner, at the intersection of Beacon and Harvard Street, offers plenty to explore. Pay a visit to the JFK National Historic Site, catch a flick at the Coolidge Corner Theatre, or do some shopping in one-of-a-kind boutiques. Nearby Boston’s Children’s Hospital and Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center.Guest AccessWe have two parking spots at the property available for $30p/day. These fill up fast so please reach out immediately to reserve your spot. The street parking in this area is heavily ticketed and does not allow for overnight parking. Please checkout the Brookline, MA website for more information on the city's suggested overnight parking. 

Nearby Garages:
Centre Street West Parking Lot, Brookline, MA 02446 
Centre Street East Parking Lot (Lot11), Centre St, Brookline, MA 02446 
Babcock St, Brookline, MA 02446 
Webster St Parking, Brookline, MA 02446InteractionOur concierge team is available for calls and replies online, however Maverick Suites does not employ 24hr staff on site. After hours calls are directed to an emergency answering service.Other things to note*All requests for early check-in / late check-out are subject to availability. Any granted request has a $25 associated fee and cannot be determined more than 48hours in advance. Any unauthorized late checkout will automatically be subject to a $25 penalty.*

What we provide:
Complimentary roll of toilet paper
Travel size shampoo, conditioner, soap
Linens and towels- if you are staying for an extended time or prefer clean linens often, you may want to bring an extra set. We only change these when our guests complete their stay. Coin operate laundry is available in the building as well. Linen refresh is available for a $25 fee. 

What to bring:
Any cooking materials and paper products (paper towels, napkins and toilet paper) as needed. 
The studio is cleaned between each stay. However, longer term guests may bring any cleaning supplies and trash bags they wish to use. 
Coffee filters for the coffeepot. 4 cup Mr Coffee maker. 
Any additional toiletries you may need during your stay.Getting AroundClose to Beacon Street and Coolidge Corner train stop on the Green Line MBTA.

Charming & Stylish Studio on Beacon Hill.description:
Our stylish and comfortable studio offers the luxury of home furnishings with the accessibility of downtown Boston and a short walk to Mass General Hospital.  Located in the historic Beacon Hill neighborhood, you’ll be immediately swept away by the old-school charm of this neighborhood. Surrounded by brownstones, coffee shops, and locals, you’ll feel right at home in this community. Steps away from the State House, MGH, and the Boston Common, this location is nothing short of perfect.The SpaceLocated on the 1st floor, our professional managed apartment is great for those in town on business, pleasure or if you are teaching at one of the great schools in Boston. Our Temple Street apartment rental offers free 40′ Plasma TV, WiFi, utilities, Flatware, Silverware and Cooking Utensils, towels, linens and convenient access to downtown Boston.  

Studio Features:
      40″ flatscreen TV with built in WIFI
      Direct Satellite TV
      Grey Lacquer Kitchen Cabinets
      All Stainless Appliances
      Italian Carera Marble Counters
      European Style Bathrooms

Property Features:

      Coin-op laundry
      Access to Iron and Ironing Board

The studio's kitchenette comes equipped with a mini fridge, microwave, two plate stove top, toaster and coffee maker.
In the city of Boston lodging laws dictate that heat must be provided to all those in the building October 15 - May 15. Unfortunately this means we are unable to revert the set-up during unseasonable warmth or chill. As these historic brownstones are supported by systems linked to one another ALL units must remain on the same system across the building.Guest AccessThe studio's kitchenette comes equipped with a mini fridge, microwave, two plate stove top, toaster and coffee maker.

Guests have access to a set of towels and linens provided upon arrival, flatware, silverware and cooking utensils, direct satellite TV, wireless internet and coin-op Laundry which is located in the building for tenants to use.

There is an access code given to each tenant which is needed to enter the front door to the building. A unique access code is generated to the unit lock granting access to you only!

Parking:
Public transportation is the suggested form of transportation as it is only less than a 5 minute walk to the Park Street Station.  There is primarily street parking reserved for residents.

Stylish Downtown Studio in the SouthEnd,.description:
The unit is stylishly designed for comfort, value and convenience. Centrally located on the line Boston’s Back Bay and South End. Quaint and chic are just 2 words to describe Boston’s South End neighborhood. In the past few years, the South End has grown to be one of Boston’s hottest neighborhoods built with families and young professionals in mind. Loaded with restaurants (some of the best in the city), art galleries, and boasting a modern industrial vibe, the South End is an ideal destination.The SpaceLocated on the 2nd floor, the studio has a private (not shared) bathroom located across the hall.  So, you have to leave the unit to access it.  There is an access code on the unit and bathroom which only the guest staying the the unit will have. Please note there is no elevator at this property.

This unit is fully furnished a double bed, table with two chairs and accessorized kitchenette. The studio's kitchenette comes equipped with a mini fridge, microwave, two plate stove top, toaster and coffee maker. Other features include:

All stainless appliances
Maple cabinets
Antique 3×6 tiling
Under sink bathroom storage

Italian track & floor lighting

A Stylish Stay w/ a Queen Bed, Heated Fl.description:
In the heart of Coolidge Corner right off the Green Line, our picturesque studio apartment is a quick train ride to Fenway, Faneuil Hall and the Back Bay. Our space is perfect for solo adventures, business travel, or visiting students at the many neighboring universities. Sleep comfortably on pillow-top mattresses. Other features include heated bathroom floors and shared beautiful stainless steel full kitchens with crafted Italian Granite counter tops.The SpaceKnown as an integral part of Boston’s neighborhoods, Coolidge Corner in Brookline is known for its modern yet heavily-rooted historic novice, as the hometown and birthplace of John F. Kennedy. The bustling community of Coolidge Corner, at the intersection of Beacon and Harvard Street, offers plenty to explore. Pay a visit to the JFK National Historic Site, catch a flick at the Coolidge Corner Theatre, or do some shopping in one-of-a-kind boutiques. Nearby Boston’s Children’s Hospital and Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center.Guest AccessWe have two parking spots at the property available for $30p/day. These fill up fast so please reach out immediately to reserve your spot. The street parking in this area is heavily ticketed and does not allow for overnight parking. Please checkout the Brookline, MA website for more information on the city's suggested overnight parking.

As these historic brownstones are supported by systems linked to one another ALL units must remain on the same system across the building.Guest AccessThe studio's kitchenette comes equipped with a mini fridge, microwave, two plate stove top, toaster and coffee maker.

Our space is perfect for solo adventures, business travel, or visiting students at the many neighboring universities. Sleep comfortably on pillow-top mattresses. Other features include heated bathroom floors and shared beautiful stainless steel full kitchens with crafted Italian Granite counter tops.The SpaceKnown as an integral part of Boston’s neighborhoods, Coolidge Corner in Brookline is known for its modern yet heavily-rooted historic novice, as the hometown and birthplace of John F. Kennedy. The bustling community of Coolidge Corner, at the intersection of Beacon and Harvard Street, offers plenty to explore. Pay a visit to the JFK National Historic Site, catch a flick at the Coolidge Corner Theatre, or do some shopping in one-of-a-kind boutiques. Nearby Boston’s Children’s Hospital and Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center.Guest AccessWe have two parking spots at the property available for $30p/day. These fill up fast so please reach out immediately to reserve your spot. The street parking in this area is heavily ticketed and does not allow for overnight parking. Please checkout the Brookline, MA website for more information on the city's suggested overnight parking. 

Nearby Garages:
Centre Street West Parking Lot, Brookline, MA 02446 
Centre Street East Parking Lot (Lot11), Centre St, Brookline, MA 02446 
Babcock St, Brookline, MA 02446 
Webster St Parking, Brookline, MA 02446InteractionOur concierge team is available for calls and replies online, however Maverick Suites does not employ 24hr staff on site. After hours calls are directed to an emergency answering service.Other things to note*All requests for early check-in / late check-out are subject to availability. Any granted request has a $25 associated fee and cannot be determined more than 48hours in advance. Any unauthorized late checkout will automatically be subject to a $25 penalty.*

What we provide:
Complimentary roll of toilet paper
Travel size shampoo, conditioner, soap
Linens and towels- if you are staying for an extended time or prefer clean linens often, you may want to bring an extra set. We only change these when our guests complete their stay. Coin operate laundry is available in the building as well. Linen refresh is available for a $25 fee. 

What to bring:
Any cooking materials and paper products (paper towels, napkins and toilet paper) as needed. 
The studio is cleaned between each stay. However, longer term guests may bring any cleaning supplies and trash bags they wish to use. 
Coffee filters for the coffeepot. 4 cup Mr Coffee maker. 
Any additional toiletries you may need during your stay.Getting AroundClose to Beacon Street and Coolidge Corner train stop on the Green Line MBTA.

Downtown Beacon Hill Convenient, Comfy S.title: Downtown Beacon Hill Convenient, Comfy Studio #10
Downtown Beacon Hill Convenient, Comfy S.description:
Our stylish and comfortable studio offers the luxury of home furnishings with the accessibility of downtown Boston and a short walk to Mass General Hospital.  

Located in the historic Beacon Hill neighborhood, you’ll be immediately swept away by the old-school charm of this neighborhood. Surrounded by brownstones, coffee shops, and locals, you’ll feel right at home in this community. Steps away from the State House, MGH, and the Boston Common, this location is nothing short of perfectThe SpaceOur professional managed apartment is great for those in town on business, pleasure or if you are teaching at one of the great schools in Boston. Our Temple Street apartment rental offers free 40′ Plasma TV, WiFi, utilities, Flatware, Silverware and Cooking Utensils, towels, linens and convenient access to downtown Boston.  Please note this unit is located on the third floor and there is no elevator at the property.

Studio Features:
      40″ flatscreen TV with built in WIFI
      Direct Satellite TV
      Grey Lacquer Kitchen Cabinets
      All Stainless Appliances
      Italian Carera Marble Counters
      European Style Bathrooms

Property Features:
      Self check-in
      Free High Speed Wireless Internet
      Coin-op laundry
      Access to Iron and Ironing Board

The studio's kitchenette comes equipped with a mini fridge, microwave, two plate stove top, toaster and coffee maker.

In the city of Boston lodging laws dictate that heat must be provided to all those in the building October 15 - May 15. Unfortunately this means we are unable to revert the set-up during unseasonable warmth or chill. As these historic brownstones are supported by systems linked to one another ALL units must remain on the same system across the building.Guest AccessThe studio's kitchenette comes equipped with a mini fridge, microwave, two plate stove top, toaster and coffee maker.

Guests have access to a set of towels and linens provided upon arrival, flatware, silverware and cooking utensils, direct satellite TV, wireless internet and coin-op Laundry which is located in the building for tenants to use.

There is an access code given to each tenant which is needed to enter the front door to the building. A unique access code is generated to the unit lock granting access to you only!

Parking:
Public transportation is the suggested form of transportation as it is only less than a 5 minute walk to the Park Street Station.  There is primarily street parking reserved for residents.  

Nearby garages:

     Longfellow Garage (0.2 miles away from the property)
     60 Staniford Street
     Boston, MA

     Laz Parking (less than a mile away from the property)
     100 Cambridge Street
     Boston, MA
     (Intersection/Between: Cambridge St & Bowdoin St)
     
     Government Center Garage (0.4 miles away from the property)
     50 New Sudbury Street
     Boston, MANeighborhoodBeacon Hill is one of Boston’s most historic neighborhoods.

Close to public transportation, the neighborhood offers antique shops, boutiques and restaurants.

Beacon Hill is regarded as the most desirable and expensive neighborhood in Boston.

Please note that we are located in the heart of the city and therefore subject to noise from street construction in the fall from the City of Boston. We are not given advance notice of these projects as they are unrelated to our business. This construction is usually not active during weekends or holidays.InteractionOur concierge team is available for calls and replies online, however Maverick Suites does not employ 24hr staff on site. After hours calls are directed to an emergency answering service.Other things to note*All requests for early check-in / late check-out are subject to availability. Any granted request has a $25 associated fee and cannot be determined more than 48hours in advance. Any unauthorized late checkout will automatically be subject to a $25 penalty.*

What we provide:
Complimentary roll of toilet paper
Travel size shampoo, conditioner, soap
Hair dryer
Linens and towels- if you are staying for an extended time or prefer clean linens often, you may want to bring an extra set. We only change these when our guests complete their stay. Coin operate laundry is available in the building as well. A linen turnover is available for a $25 fee. 

What to bring:
Any cooking materials and paper products (paper towels, napkins and toilet paper) as needed. 
The studio is cleaned between each stay. However, longer term guests may bring any cleaning supplies and trash bags they wish to use. 
Coffee filters for the coffeepot. It is a 4cup Mr Coffee.
Any additional toiletries you may need during your stay.Getting AroundBoston is widely known as a “walkable city” meaning you can get anywhere you need to go via foot. However, public transportation is not at a minimum at this location where you are close to both the Red Line at MGH, and the Green Line at Park Street. While walking through the streets of Beacon Hill, don’t be surprised if you stumble upon a tour group being lead by someone dressed in full colonial garb, this property is located on the Freedom Trail after all!

Stylish Downtown Studio in the Boston, C.description:
The unit is stylishly designed for comfort, value and convenience. Centrally located on the line Boston’s Back Bay and South End. Quaint and chic are just 2 words to describe Boston’s South End neighborhood. In the past few years, the South End has grown to be one of Boston’s hottest neighborhoods built with families and young professionals in mind. Loaded with restaurants (some of the best in the city), art galleries, and boasting a modern industrial vibe, the South End is an ideal destination.The SpaceLocated on the 3rd floor, the studio has a private (not shared) bathroom located across the hall.  So, you have to leave the unit to access it.  There is an access code on the unit and bathroom which only the guest staying the the unit will have. There is no elevator at this property.

Comfy Beacon Hill Studio Great for Work.title: Comfy Beacon Hill Studio Great for Work Travel; #7
Comfy Beacon Hill Studio Great for Work.description:
Our stylish and comfortable studio offers the luxury of home furnishings with the accessibility of downtown Boston and a short walk to Mass General Hospital.  Located in the historic Beacon Hill neighborhood, you’ll be immediately swept away by the old-school charm of this neighborhood. Surrounded by brownstones, coffee shops, and locals, you’ll feel right at home in this community. Steps away from the State House, MGH, and the Boston Common, this location is nothing short of perfect.The SpaceOur professional managed apartment is great for those in town on business, pleasure or if you are teaching at one of the great schools in Boston. Our Temple Street apartment rental offers free 40′ Plasma TV, WiFi, utilities, Flatware, Silverware and Cooking Utensils, towels, linens and convenient access to downtown Boston.  Please note this unit is located on the second floor and there is no elevator at the property. 

Studio Features:
      40″ flatscreen TV with built in WIFI
      Direct Satellite TV
      Grey Lacquer Kitchen Cabinets
      All Stainless Appliances
      Italian Carera Marble Counters
      European Style Bathrooms

Property Features:
      Self check-in
      Free High Speed Wireless Internet
      Coin-op laundry
      Access to Iron and Ironing Board

The studio's kitchenette comes equipped with a mini fridge, microwave, two plate stove top, toaster and coffee maker.

In the city of Boston lodging laws dictate that heat must be provided to all those in the building October 15 - May 15. Unfortunately this means we are unable to revert the set-up during unseasonable warmth or chill. As these historic brownstones are supported by systems linked to one another ALL units must remain on the same system across the building.Guest AccessThe studio's kitchenette comes equipped with a mini fridge, microwave, two plate stove top, toaster and coffee maker.

Guests have access to a set of towels and linens provided upon arrival, flatware, silverware and cooking utensils, direct satellite TV, wireless internet and coin-op Laundry which is located in the building for tenants to use.

There is an access code given to each tenant which is needed to enter the front door to the building. which The unit has an access code to enter the unit.

Public transportation is the suggested form of transportation as it is only less than a 5 minute walk to the Park Street Station.  There is primarily street parking reserved for residents.

Beacon Hill is regarded as the most desirable and expensive neighborhood in Boston.

Charming & Stylish Studio on Beacon Hill.title: Charming & Stylish Studio on Beacon Hill; #2
Charming & Stylish Studio on Beacon Hill.description:
Our stylish and comfortable studio offers the luxury of home furnishings with the accessibility of downtown Boston and a short walk to Mass General Hospital.  

Located in the historic Beacon Hill neighborhood, you’ll be immediately swept away by the old-school charm of this neighborhood. Surrounded by brownstones, coffee shops, and locals, you’ll feel right at home in this community. Steps away from the State House, MGH, and the Boston Common, this location is nothing short of perfect.The SpaceLocated on the 1st floor, our professional managed apartment is great for those in town on business, pleasure or if you are teaching at one of the great schools in Boston. Our Temple Street apartment rental offers free 40′ Plasma TV, WiFi, utilities, Flatware, Silverware and Cooking Utensils, towels, linens and convenient access to downtown Boston.  

Studio Features:
      40″ flatscreen TV with built in WIFI
      Direct Satellite TV
      Grey Lacquer Kitchen Cabinets
      All Stainless Appliances
      Italian Carera Marble Counters
      European Style Bathrooms

Property Features:
      Self check-in
      Free High Speed Wireless Internet
      Coin-op laundry
      Access to Iron and Ironing Board

The studio's kitchenette comes equipped with a mini fridge, microwave, two plate stove top, toaster and coffee maker.
In the city of Boston lodging laws dictate that heat must be provided to all those in the building October 15 - May 15. Unfortunately this means we are unable to revert the set-up during unseasonable warmth or chill. As these historic brownstones are supported by systems linked to one another ALL units must remain on the same system across the building.Guest AccessThe studio's kitchenette comes equipped with a mini fridge, microwave, two plate stove top, toaster and coffee maker.

Guests have access to a set of towels and linens provided upon arrival, flatware, silverware and cooking utensils, direct satellite TV, wireless internet and coin-op Laundry which is located in the building for tenants to use.

There is an access code given to each tenant which is needed to enter the front door to the building. A unique access code is generated to the unit lock granting access to you only!

Parking:
Public transportation is the suggested form of transportation as it is only less than a 5 minute walk to the Park Street Station.  There is primarily street parking reserved for residents.  

Nearby garages:

     Longfellow Garage (0.2 miles away from the property)
     60 Staniford Street
     Boston, MA

     Laz Parking (less than a mile away from the property)
     100 Cambridge Street
     Boston, MA
     (Intersection/Between: Cambridge St & Bowdoin St)
     
     Government Center Garage (0.4 miles away from the property)
     50 New Sudbury Street
     Boston, MANeighborhoodBeacon Hill is one of Boston’s most historic neighborhoods.

Close to public transportation, the neighborhood offers antique shops, boutiques and restaurants.

Beacon Hill is regarded as the most desirable and expensive neighborhood in Boston.

Please note that we are located in the heart of the city and therefore subject to noise from street construction in the fall from the City of Boston. We are not given advance notice of these projects as they are unrelated to our business. This construction is usually not active during weekends or holidays.InteractionOur concierge team is available for calls and replies online, however Maverick Suites does not employ 24hr staff on site. After hours calls are directed to an emergency answering service.Other things to note*All requests for early check-in / late check-out are subject to availability. Any granted request has a $25 associated fee and cannot be determined more than 48hours in advance. Any unauthorized late checkout will automatically be subject to a $25 penalty.*

What we provide:
Complimentary roll of toilet paper
Travel size shampoo, conditioner, soap
Hair dryer
Linens and towels- if you are staying for an extended time or prefer clean linens often, you may want to bring an extra set. We only change these when our guests complete their stay. Coin operate laundry is available in the building as well. A linen turnover is available for a $25 fee. 

What to bring:
Any cooking materials and paper products (paper towels, napkins and toilet paper) as needed. 
The studio is cleaned between each stay. However, longer term guests may bring any cleaning supplies and trash bags they wish to use. 
Coffee filters for the coffeepot. It is a 4cup Mr Coffee.
Any additional toiletries you may need during your stay.Getting AroundBoston is widely known as a “walkable city” meaning you can get anywhere you need to go via foot. However, public transportation is not at a minimum at this location where you are close to both the Red Line at MGH, and the Green Line at Park Street. While walking through the streets of Beacon Hill, don’t be surprised if you stumble upon a tour group being lead by someone dressed in full colonial garb, this property is located on the Freedom Trail after all!

     (Intersection/Between: Cambridge St & Bowdoin St)
     
     Government Center Garage (0.4 miles away from the property)
     50 New Sudbury Street
     Boston, MANeighborhoodBeacon Hill is one of Boston’s most historic neighborhoods.

Close to public transportation, the neighborhood offers antique shops, boutiques and restaurants.

Beacon Hill is regarded as the most desirable and expensive neighborhood in Boston.

Please note that we are located in the heart of the city and therefore subject to noise from street construction in the fall from the City of Boston. We are not given advance notice of these projects as they are unrelated to our business. This construction is usually not active during weekends or holidays.InteractionOur concierge team is available for calls and replies online, however Maverick Suites does not employ 24hr staff on site. After hours calls are directed to an emergency answering service.Other things to note*All requests for early check-in / late check-out are subject to availability. Any granted request has a $25 associated fee and cannot be determined more than 48hours in advance. Any unauthorized late checkout will automatically be subject to a $25 penalty.*

What we provide:
Complimentary roll of toilet paper
Travel size shampoo, conditioner, soap
Hair dryer
Linens and towels- if you are staying for an extended time or prefer clean linens often, you may want to bring an extra set. We only change these when our guests complete their stay. Coin operate laundry is available in the building as well. A linen turnover is available for a $25 fee. 

What to bring:
Any cooking materials and paper products (paper towels, napkins and toilet paper) as needed. 
The studio is cleaned between each stay. However, longer term guests may bring any cleaning supplies and trash bags they wish to use. 
Coffee filters for the coffeepot. It is a 4cup Mr Coffee.
Any additional toiletries you may need during your stay.Getting AroundBoston is widely known as a “walkable city” meaning you can get anywhere you need to go via foot. However, public transportation is not at a minimum at this location where you are close to both the Red Line at MGH, and the Green Line at Park Street. While walking through the streets of Beacon Hill, don’t be surprised if you stumble upon a tour group being lead by someone dressed in full colonial garb, this property is located on the Freedom Trail after all!

A Stylish Stay w/ a Queen Bed, Heated Fl.description:
In the heart of Coolidge Corner right off the Green Line, our picturesque studio apartment is a quick train ride to Fenway, Faneuil Hall and the Back Bay. Our space is perfect for solo adventures, business travel, or visiting students at the many neighboring universities. Sleep comfortably on pillow-top mattresses. Other features include heated bathroom floors and shared beautiful stainless steel full kitchens with crafted Italian Granite counter tops.The SpaceKnown as an integral part of Boston’s neighborhoods, Coolidge Corner in Brookline is known for its modern yet heavily-rooted historic novice, as the hometown and birthplace of John F. Kennedy. The bustling community of Coolidge Corner, at the intersection of Beacon and Harvard Street, offers plenty to explore. Pay a visit to the JFK National Historic Site, catch a flick at the Coolidge Corner Theatre, or do some shopping in one-of-a-kind boutiques. Nearby Boston’s Children’s Hospital and Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center.

This studio features shared porch access with the neighboring unit.Guest AccessWe have two parking spots at the property available for $30p/day. These fill up fast so please reach out immediately to reserve your spot. The street parking in this area is heavily ticketed and the town of Brookline does not allow for overnight street parking. Please checkout the Brookline, MA website for more information on the city's suggested overnight parking lots.

South End Studio Perfect for Work Travel.title: South End Studio Perfect for Work Travel #26
South End Studio Perfect for Work Travel.description:
The unit is stylishly designed for comfort, value and convenience. Centrally located on the line Boston’s Back Bay and South End. Quaint and chic are just 2 words to describe Boston’s South End neighborhood. In the past few years, the South End has grown to be one of Boston’s hottest neighborhoods built with families and young professionals in mind. Loaded with restaurants (some of the best in the city), art galleries, and boasting a modern industrial vibe, the South End is an ideal destination.The SpaceThis unit is fully furnished a double bed, counter space with chair and accessorized kitchenette. The studio's kitchenette comes equipped with a mini fridge, microwave, two plate stove top, toaster and coffee maker. This unit is on the second floor; please note there is no elevator at the property. 

Other features include:
Free Wireless Internet
Direct satellite TV
All stainless appliances
Maple cabinets
Antique 3×6 tiling
Remote controlled air
Italian track & floor lighting
Side street view

Please note: Due to an extensive HVAC issues, our studios are being heater by space heaters until Winter 2022Guest AccessEach studio includes all utilities, high-speed wireless internet, direct satellite TV; set of towels and linens are provided upon arrival, flatware, silverware and cooking utensils; coin-op Laundry on 4th floor of building.

Parking: Public transportation is the suggested form of transportation as it is only a 5 minute walk to the Back Bay Station (Orange Line) and Prudential Stations (Green Line). There is primarily street parking reserved for residents. For overnight parking we suggest the below garages that accept advanced reservations to help keep cost down.

Nearby Garages:

126 South Dartmouth St Garage (0.2 mi away from the property)

Copley Place Garage (0.3 mi away from the property)

Coffee filters for the coffeepot. 4 cup Mr Coffee maker. 
Any additional toiletries you may need during your stay.Getting AroundFilled with restaurants, bakeries, art galleries, and local shops, there is no wrong turn when traveling through Boston’s bustling South End neighborhood. This location is walking distance to the Symphony, Prudential Center, and is a short train or bus ride to Downtown Boston, South Boston and the Seaport.

Beautiful 2Bedroom in the South End, Gar.title: Beautiful 2Bedroom in the South End, Garden Unit
Beautiful 2Bedroom in the South End, Gar.description:
This charming two-bedroom South End apartment is located inside one of the area's charming Brownstones, providing a quintessential Boston experience. The apartment is fully furnished and can comfortably accommodate up to 5 travelers or extended stay guests.  

Our building is located in one of Boston's most vibrant communities. This tree-lined neighborhood is known for its fine dining, art galleries, the open market, and smiling faces.The SpaceThis modernly designed two-bedroom apartment features a private entrance and direct access to a semi-private brick patio. Each bedroom features a queen-size bed with new memory foam mattresses and comfortable linens. The pull-out sofa in the living room makes this unit suitable for up to 5 guests (Please note the pull out couch is not automatically set up with linen and has a $25 Linen Fee attached for this request) The apartment also has a kitchen & living room.

The kitchen is fully stocked with essential cookware, utensils, coffeemaker, and other necessities.Guest AccessEach studio includes all utilities, high-speed wireless internet, direct satellite TV; set of towels and linens are provided upon arrival, flatware, silverware and cooking utensils; coin-op Laundry on 1st floor of building.
